summary: This is an FBI Miami Division request to the Document Conversion Laboratory (DocLab) for scanning and processing telephone records related to an obstruction of justice investigation. The investigation targets a former house manager/butler to Jeffrey Epstein who allegedly attempted to sell an address book containing potential victim contact information rather than comply with subpoenas.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of a child prostitution case
persons.context: The document states the obstruction of justice investigation relates to his former house manager/butler possessing an address book believed to contain contact information for additional underage victims.

events.title: Miami Division opens obstruction of justice case
events.description: The FBI Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Jeffrey Epstein's former house manager/butler.

keyFacts: The FBI Miami Division was investigating an individual, Epstein's former house manager/butler, for obstruction of justice in October 2009.

The subject of the investigation allegedly came into possession of an address book containing names and telephone numbers believed to belong to additional, previously unknown underage victims of Jeffrey Epstein.

The subject allegedly attempted to sell the address book to an unspecified party ('a LICE' - likely a typo/redaction) instead of turning it over to law enforcement or attorneys in response to federal subpoenas.
The document is a request to scan and process telephone records obtained from that address book for incorporation into the FBI's Telephone Application (TA) database.
The case number referenced is 72-MM-113327, and the request is part of a 'Baleen Sweep' project for processing telephone records.
